result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Antonio Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
Stayed pending a review on 8/21/2015.

**08-21-15/PRH**
Defendant is currently in absconder status and non-compliance with probation conditions. Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days in HOC STRAIGHT TIME, with no good time credit.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant is currently in absconder status.  Court ordered defendant to serve 20 days of the condition time; straight time.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
Letter from DOC seeking amended JOC with notation that JOC will not be amended per Judge Dugan (see note written on letter).  No action taken.  jbs

Defendant Michael Antonio Smith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Michael Antonio Smith in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 44 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days consecutive in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  
COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 8/21/15.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Court has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNTS 2 AS AMENDED AND COUNT 3:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Michael Antonio Smith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Michael Antonio Smith in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor.

Defendant Michael Antonio Smith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Michael Antonio Smith in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  State put the offer on the record.  Case passed.

Defendant Michael Antonio Smith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 5/18/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions filed by Atty. T.R. Williams.
Motion in Limine filed by Atty. T.R. Williams.

Defendant Michael Antonio Smith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.
Case not on court calendar.    Defense enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND and would like an earlier trial date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $5000.00

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Michael Antonio Smith not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Giovanni V. and C.D.V.(11-28-00).

Defendant Michael Antonio Smith in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Michael Antonio Smith in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk. 
 Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
